description:
Android Developer

Job description

At Mimo, we believe that coding can open doors to careers and opportunities like few other skills. That's why we've rallied around the common goal of making coding universally accessible.

If you, too, want to make coding accessible to everybody, this is your opportunity to shape the future of tech education.

Your responsibilities

  • Working closely with other Android developers across teams, giving feedback on and reviewing PRs, engaging in pair programming sessions, and sharing knowledge
  • Specifying and breaking down features from idea to implementation
  • Writing unit tests for logic changes
  • Helping shape the product by participating in creative sessions and pitching ideas within your team

  • MVVM combined with a clean-architecture approach
  • A healthy dose of Jetpack, Firebase, and some open-source libraries
  • Bitrise/GitHub Actions as our CI/CD

  • 3+ years of experience in Android app development
  • Strong knowledge of Kotlin
  • Very good written and verbal communication skills in English for documentation, feedback, reviews, specifications, and other exchanges

At Mimo, we're not just accepting differences among team members – we're celebrating and promoting them. That’s why we’re committed to mitigating bias and providing equal opportunity in everything we do, including this hiring process.

Your annual salary will range from €52k to €80k, depending on your contract type and if you want to have an equity stake in Mimo, and will automatically increase by at least 5% every year.

If this role and workplace culture sound like you, we can't wait to hear from you!

title: Product Designer
description:
Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive. 

At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.

How you’ll make an impact 

Xero Product Designers are responsible for designing beautiful, enabling and meaningful experiences that solve genuine customer problems. As a Product Designer you’ll work on small-medium scale projects within a product area of a portfolio and contribute to larger scale projects as part of a team.

What you’ll do 

Design practice and thinking Work with your Design Manager and more senior product designers to understand the Product Design vision and direction and build your design practice, focusing on consistency and quality of execution within your product design delivery. 

● Promote the value of design and collaborative practice across spheres of influence and participation 

● Conduct desk research including domain and competitor analysis, interaction/design trends and 'best of' examples 

● Analyse relevant considerations such as research insights (when not directly involved), product strategy and roadmaps, technical environment and constraints 

● Contribute to the definition and articulation of ‘the problem’ 

● Create simple frameworks such as wireframes low/high-fi, visual frameworks, which articulate the components, journeys and elements required to solve 'the problem' 

● Explore ideal future concepts that meet customer needs in the best possible way 

● Work with others to develop phased design solutions that bridge the gap between a future state and current patterns, XUI design system and other relevant constraints and considerations 

● Create prototypes which tangibly demonstrate a proposed concept or solution 

● Collaborate with other designers to test ideas, share challenges, seek feedback and build quality in your practice 

● Collaborate with content designers to ensure content within an experience is consistent, 'fit for purpose' and meets customer needs 

● Develop detailed interactions and interfaces which are smart and contextually relevant 

● Present and communicate design work to a range of different audiences 

● Create effective handover materials which clearly communicate how the design should look and behave throughout interaction flows and journeys (e.g. User flow diagrams, design specifications, experience/interaction specifications etc) 

Design research and testing Contribute to identifying research opportunities, planning and undertaking research and testing relevant to your product area. 

● Participate in generative user research to understand customer underlying goals, needs, behaviors and pain points (where necessary) 

● Participate in the synthesis of research data, drawing out and articulation of insights 

● Participate in user testing 

Relationship management Develop effective cross functional relationships and build influence 

● Participate in cross functional team workshops 

● Collaborate with cross functional teams to ensure proposed solutions balance user needs, business strategy and technical constraints 

● Collaborate with development teams during sprints to provide design QA and problem solve issues as they arise

Success looks like

  • You’re delivering designs on schedule against agreed deadlines, to the highest quality standards. 
  • You’re consistently delivering high quality solutions to meet customer and business problems 
  • You’re collaborating and contributing to your Design, Product, and Development teams

What you’ll bring with you

  • Track record of delivering quality design experiences 
  • Track record of solving customers' problems through design 
  • Excellent communication skills and experience working directly with engineering and research teams
  • A portfolio that demonstrates high-quality design outcomes, contributing to user experience and business value 
  • Skill and experience across the design process from uncovering customer needs and pain points, to executing elegant interfaces

As a permanent remote worker at Xero we want to ensure you are getting the same #beautiful employee experience as our in-office Xero’s. Permanent remote Xero’s will benefit from a virtual ergonomic work assessment and funding to assist with the improvement of your at home work setup. Xero will also fund up to 4 trips a year to your most relevant region Xero office. You are part of our #team and we want to see you thrive!

About Xero?

Diversity of people brings diversity of thought, and we like that. A collaborative and inclusive environment is important to us. Working at Xero will provide you with a diverse and inclusive environment alongside people who will respect, challenge and support you to have fun while you do the best work of your life. We are a place where personal development, innovation, and well-being are not just inspired but celebrated.

We value our people and offer a wide range of compelling benefits and perks, including Xero shares and great parental leave policies.  Xero’s collaborative culture is underscored by our values - #Ownership, #Challenge, #Beautiful, #Human and #Team - which empower us to understand and serve customers, attract top talent and continuously innovate. From the moment you step through our doors, you’ll feel welcome and supported to do the best work of your life.

Please note that we currently require all employees and contractors to be vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to work from a Xero office, or engage in any face-to-face Xero business. Xero will work with anyone who is not vaccinated, or prefers not to disclose their vaccination status, to determine if any reasonable accommodations can be provided to ensure their role can be performed safely whilst the restriction is in place.

  • Collaborate. Close coordination with the Product team to develop a shared vision of a product or feature and then lead a process to define the design to deliver on the product’s objectives. Close communication with the Engineering team to ensure delivery of features meet design requirements.

  • Problem-solve. Strategize & execute on how design helps solve complex problems across multiple apps. Evaluate quality on both design-centric and data driven metrics in regular reviews.  

About You:

  • Passionate. You live and breathe design. You regularly stay up to date on current design trends and enjoy learning new skills as a designer. You have a passion for the user’s experience and the ability to execute that with meaningful and elegant design. Love what you do and have fun in the process.
  • Analytical. You have deep knowledge of user-centered design and usability best practices. You understand and respond to performance data (metric tests, usability studies), and steer the direction of future creative designs. You are able to backup your design decisions with meaningful data or reasoning.
  • Experienced. Experience in managing workload against resources and competing priorities, successfully working with leadership and cross-functional teams. You have a great UX/UI portfolio, demonstrating outstanding design, execution, and problem solving skills.

  • Proficiency with design tools such as Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Invision
  • An online portfolio demonstrating conceptual thinking and creative problem solving
  • Ability to translate wireframes into outstanding visual/UI design
  • Advanced understanding of CSS and HTML
  • BA/BS degree in Design or similar background or equivalent practical experience
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in UX/UI design
  • Experience managing multiple projects and the ability to meet aggressive deadlines
  • Ability to work cross-team and synthesize feedback from multiple teams/owners
  • Experience designing for responsive platforms

Big Pluses:

  • Ability to prototype interactions/designs
  • Experience building and managing design systems across multiple products
  • Experience with Atomic Design Principles & Methodology
  • Experience using analytical tools such as Google Analytics and/or Looker
  • Experience using Jira, Confluence, and GitHub Issues

If you value strategy, work creatively, have a passion for crafting compelling content, and if you love working with an amazing team in a dynamic environment, this will be a perfect fit.

Reporting to the Director of Content Marketing & Strategy, you will help represent the voice of Evernote to our social audience, including current and future users, the Evernote Expert community, and members of the Notable Herd (our employees!) across Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, and TikTok.

You will conceptualize, create, and post social media content, report on vital metrics, manage the social media calendar, and engage with users from behind our @evernote handles. You will deliver a qualitative strategy that's creatively driven, with the ability to pivot completely or jump on emerging trends at a moment's notice. You will adapt existing content for social channels and pitch your own ideas for new social-first initiatives to support our company goals.

What you’ll do

  • Work with the Director of Content Marketing and Strategy and other key members of the marketing team to develop evergreen, product-specific, and campaign-related social content 
  • Conceptualize, create, and post social media content to drive brand and product awareness, including writing captions and comments in the Evernote voice and designing brand-aligned visual assets (working with our in-house creative studio as needed)
  • Set key performance indicators (KPIs) for social media campaigns, such as target numbers for engagement rate, follower growth, impressions, likes, and shares, then measure and report on campaign performance 
  • Work with our Content, Community, Product Marketing, and Customer Marketing teams to discover, curate and share compelling stories about our brand and community; identify opportunities to amplify content across various social media
  • Assist in the monitoring and amplification of our influencer marketing program, including paid creators, our Evernote Expert community, and organically earned content
  • Monitor vital metrics and data, surface insights, and report monthly on growth and performance across Evernote's social channels

What you’ve done

  • B.A./B.S. degree preferred, or equivalent experience
  • 3-5+ years experience working in social media marketing
  • Experience creating social media content and strategies for building brand awareness and penetrating new audiences
  • Experience and knowledge of social media best practices, influencer marketing programs, and what makes for engaging content
  • Experience using marketing tools and platforms such as Sprinklr, Airtable, Later, Kochava, Google Analytics, Canva, and more

Who you are

  • A compelling storyteller who can weave together words, visuals, and numbers to create engaging social media content
  • A people person who works well with others and loves to collaborate cross-functionally
  • A creative spirit who stays on top of social trends and is always thinking one step ahead
  • Someone with exceptional project management skills and who knows how to stay on top of things and meet deadlines
  • Someone with the ability to think globally while acting locally — Evernote is a global company with users all across the world
  • Passionate about social media and the content we consume on a daily basis, you understand what separates the good from the phenomenal

Bonus areas

  • Interest in organization and productivity technology trends
  • TikTok aficionado
  • Prior experience in tech, product, SaaS, or consumer marketing

We are committed to an inclusive and diverse Evernote. We believe that different perspectives lead to better ideas, and better ideas allow us to better understand the needs and interests of our diverse, global Evernote Community. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives and are an equal opportunity employer.

description:
CodeCombat is looking for a Marketing Associate to spearhead content marketing and other promotional initiatives on a small team in an education-focused startup. This is a great opportunity for someone looking to join a growing, flexible, and mission-driven organization at the ground floor. 

This is a 100% remote, contractor-to-hire role. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

What You'll Do

  • Social media calendaring and creative design
  • Content marketing, including blog drafting and press solicitation
  • Identify partners & track posts for our affiliate/Influencer program
  • Sales collateral development
  • Competitive research and analysis
  • Administrative support for our academic esports tournaments
  • Business development support; lead sourcing and prospecting, reporting

Who You Are

  • Experience executing marketing initiatives
  • Technical acumen with the ability to quickly learn tools and processes (GSuite, social platforms and social platform aggregators, image editing, email automation systems)
  • Strong written communication skills; ability to articulate nuanced core messaging to parents, educators, and students
  • Experience designing creative customer-facing assets
  • Resourceful; comfortable working in a remote startup setting
  • Ability to work independently on marketing initiatives, projects

Bonus Points (nice to have, but not required)

  • Experience in community development or a related field
  • Experience wearing many hats in a small org or team
  • Exposure to paid advertising platforms (Google, FB)

Who We Are

CodeCombat is building a new way for K-12 students and at-home learners to learn how to code, using real programming languages to explore adventure games. Students learn how to write functions to control their hero avatars, implement puzzle-solving strategies, and code their own games. We are committed to researching, experimenting, and iterating new ways to marry education with fun for students worldwide.  

We recently released Ozaria, a Computer Science program, adventure game, and fantasy story where students master core Computer Science concepts. The unfolding narrative creates a powerful and engaging student-centered learning experience, with each student’s investment in Ozaria’s story paralleling the investment they are making in their own learning journey.  

We are a small, determined, and tight-knit startup dedicated to providing an enjoyable, meaningful place to work. Team members pursue a healthy work/life balance with flexible working hours. All of our team members work remotely from all around the world, with concentrations in San Francisco and Beijing.

Our Values

Our work is purposeful.

We bring our personal best every day, because our game-based learning can be life-changing for young people.  

Strength comes from interdependence.

We recognize that each of us is central to the mission of CodeCombat. We know our differences create strength and resilience. We engage one another with respect for who we are, not only what we do. We create community with intention, because we need each other–and because it's fun.  

Kind, not just "nice".

We don't let fear of not being "nice" get in the way of the direct communication that underpins healthy relationships. We build strong connections through honest dialogue, even when the conversations are difficult.  

Structure can be liberating.

Transparent processes let us focus on making the right decisions–and they create channels for diverse voices to speak. Eliminate information silos and shadow structures; create known communication channels and clear responsibilities.  

We can operate at any speed.

We're thoughtful about how fast we go. We pay attention when the lights change. Sometimes we walk.  

Learning and growth go hand-in-hand.

Every experience is an opportunity to learn, and our team is growing every day. When we think we know it all, it means we have more to learn.
